meanings.definition: A type of grape native to the southern United States.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed picking scuppernongs from the vine.
meanings.sent2: The farmers sold baskets of ripe scuppernongs at the market.
meanings.sent3: Grandma made a delicious pie using scuppernongs she found in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly picked scuppernongs filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The sweet taste of scuppernongs lingered on their tongues.

meanings.definition: The vine on which scuppernongs grow.
meanings.sent1: The old oak tree provided shade for the scuppernongs to thrive.
meanings.sent2: The tangled scuppernongs vines climbed up the trellis.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the scuppernongs vine as a swing.
meanings.sent4: The lush green leaves of the scuppernongs vine danced in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The juicy scuppernongs hung temptingly from the vine.

meanings.definition: To scuppernong: to harvest or gather scuppernongs.
meanings.sent1: The farmers would scuppernong the ripe grapes early in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She decided to scuppernong the scuppernongs before the birds got to them.
meanings.sent3: The friends planned to scuppernong together for a fun day out.
meanings.sent4: He would often scuppernong alone, enjoying the peaceful task.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to scuppernong the abundant harvest.
